item.title: LATI Presents: Rei
item.description: Piece: Rei Performers: From left to right Kohtaro Yamakawa Kara Drapala Adam Shy Mitsue Kajikawa Patsy Matsushita Backline Shime Daniel Olsen Katie Durnbaugh Isaku Kageyama Composed by: Isaku Kageyama Taught by: Isaku Kageyama Location: James Armstrong Theater in Torrance, CA Thoughts on my playing Keep arms up the entire time, looks lazy Left hand is moving before the hit, makign it weaker Look up more, use head more Get lower and closer to the drum Bounce less

item.title: LATI Presents: Quitiplas in the Pocket
item.description: Piece: Quitiplas in the Pocket ManMan studied Quitiplas (ki-ti-pla) with Venezuelan artist Jackeline Rago in 2013. This music was originally created by the enslaved African-Venezuelan incorporating bamboo sticks when their drums were destroyed and banned by the enslavers. The polyrhythm in quitiplas celebrates freedom of expression and creates a musical conversation that builds community. Empowered by the essence of quitiplas, this taiko piece celebrates the joy of diversity in musical expression.

item.title: LATI Presents: Yodan Uchi
item.description: Piece: Yodan Uchi. More details about Yodan Uchi: https://taikosource.com/articles/nidan-uchiyodan-uchi/ Performers: Fred Visaya Jr. (9) Daniel Olsen (6 Duet) Wendy Ito Wolf Finn (5) Sarah Gilbert (8) Kara Drapala (6 Duet) Katie Durnbaugh (2) Kohtaro Yamakawa (4) Michael Naishtut (1) Noah Garbarino (3) Ariel R (7) Composed by: Sukeroku Taiko: Kionari Tosha, Saburo Mochizuki, Sado Kobayashi, Yoshihisa Ishikura in 1968. Taught by: Yuta Kato with official permission to teach by Kionari Tosha and Saburo Mochizuki.

item.title: Yamakawa Presents: Odaiko Zubon Solo
item.description: Piece: Odaiko Zubon (Work in Progress) by Kohtaro Yamakawa Performers: Kohtaro Yamakawa Composed by: Kohtaro Yamakawa Video Shot by: Kohtaro Yamakawa Location: Asano Taiko US Studio in Torrance, CA Thoughts on my playing Softer intro Intro needs more level change in legs ‘Rich Kid Asshole’ section needs to be straight arm at the top hits More crescendos and change the sound. Use top of the drum more. Double hand hits should be cleaner

item.title: Yamakawa Presents: Odaiko Solo Improvisation
item.description: Piece: Odaiko Solo Improvisation by Kohtaro Yamakawa Performers: - Kohtaro Yamakawa Taught by: Isaku Kageyama Video Shot by: Isaku Kageyama Location: Isaku Kageyama studio (North Hollywood) Thoughts on my playing Prepare better.
